title: Further Reading
subtitle: A curated set of related projects and catalogues we use for discovery, context, and migration research.

governance.title: How this section is used
governance.line1: Links on this page are references, not endorsements or automatic imports.
governance.line2: Every alternative still has to pass our Decision Matrix gateway checks and trust-scoring workflow.

directories.title: Directories and Comparison Hubs
directories.description: Broader recommendation sites and directories with overlapping scope.

publicCatalogues.title: EU Public-Sector Catalogues
publicCatalogues.description: Open-source catalogues maintained for European public administration reuse.

migrationGuides.title: Migration Campaigns and Guides
migrationGuides.description: Practical guides focused on helping people switch away from Big Tech.

european-alternatives-eu.summary: A European alternatives directory with explicit listing rules, labels, and community suggestions.
european-alternatives-eu.howToUse: Use it to discover missing vendors or categories and to compare listing criteria.
european-alternatives-eu.caveat: Its methodology differs from this repo, so entries must be re-evaluated under our matrix.

privacy-guides-tools.summary: A global privacy recommendations hub with broad category coverage and documented criteria.
privacy-guides-tools.howToUse: Use it as a non-EU benchmark for security and privacy tooling discovery.
privacy-guides-tools.caveat: It is not EU-focused, so jurisdiction requirements still need full local evaluation.

prism-break.summary: A long-running FOSS-first recommendation project using prefer/avoid mappings.
prism-break.howToUse: Use it for candidate discovery and historical context on privacy-first alternatives.
prism-break.caveat: Its inclusion model differs from our gateway and trust-scoring process.

eu-oss-catalogue.summary: An EU-level federated catalogue of open-source solutions from public-sector catalogues.
eu-oss-catalogue.howToUse: Use it to find public-sector OSS candidates and metadata signals like source catalogues.
eu-oss-catalogue.caveat: Catalogue presence is only a discovery signal, not proof of fit for our categories.

digital-independence-day.summary: A recurring migration campaign with concrete switch recipes and additional alternatives.
digital-independence-day.howToUse: Use it to identify practical migration journeys and user-facing switch narratives.
digital-independence-day.caveat: Guides prioritize practical switching steps and do not replace our evidentiary vetting.
